intro: Hoya seanwhistleriana, commonly known as the Whistler's Hoya, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is a popular houseplant due to its ease of care and attractive appearance. Hoya seanwhistleriana thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil.
